1.text: Sketch an outline of the face and body.

2.text: Sketch the eyes, nose and ears.

3.text: Sketch circles for the base of the cow’s limbs.

4.text: Sketch the tail, and add details to the limbs of the cow.

5.text: Frame the face and add details like the mouth and nose.

6.text: Darken the outline of the cow’s body and add the udders.

7.text: Add details, like spots on the cow's body.

9.text: Draw an outline of the body.

10.text: Add a small oblong for the base of the foreleg and a bigger oblong for the base of the hind leg.

11.text: Add the limbs, taking note of the joints using small circles.

12.text: Refine details of the face by adding the eyes, nose and mouth.

13.text: Using your outline, darken desired lines to form the cow’s trunk.

14.text: Refine the lines of the limbs and tail.

15.text: Erase unnecessary lines and add random small strokes on the cow’s body.

17.text: Draw small and big circles as guides for the head and the body.

18.text: Then, sketch the nose and the mouth.

19.text: Add the face, the nose, the ears, the small horns, the eyes and the mouth.

21.text: Add more shape to the body of the cow.

22.text: Draw the basic outlines of the cow.

23.text: Add more details like grass, patches on the skin, etc.

25.text: Sketch the main body of the cow as a big rectangle.

26.text: Sketch the legs by drawing 3 connect oblongs of decreasing size.

27.text: Repeat the previous step for another set of legs.

28.text: Sketch the guidelines for the front legs.

29.text: Add more shape to the front legs.

30.text: Sketch the guide for the head.

31.text: Connect the head to the body.

32.text: Sketch the ears and the face.

33.text: Add more details like the tail and the udder.

35.text: Add more details like grass, patches, shadowing, etc.

36.text: Color the cow as you like.
